keyword: how many calories in a whole rotisserie chicken
title: How Many Calories in a Whole Rotisserie Chicken?
meta_description: Learn how many calories in a whole rotisserie chicken, with a full nutrition breakdown including protein, fat, sodium, and easy tweaks for healthier options.
h1: How Many Calories in a Whole Rotisserie Chicken?
assumptions: Average 3-4 lb (1.4-1.8 kg) whole chicken, skin-on, roasted with basic salt and seasonings; edible portion approx. 800g meat.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by chicken size, brand, seasonings, cooking method, and skin removal; check labels or packaging when available.

quick_answer.text: A whole rotisserie chicken provides about 1800 kcal and 140 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories are in a whole rotisserie chicken?
faqs.a: Approximately 1800 kcal for an average skin-on rotisserie chicken.

faqs.q: How much protein in a whole rotisserie chicken?
faqs.a: About 140 g of protein, making it a great high-protein meal.

faqs.q: Does removing the skin reduce calories in rotisserie chicken?
faqs.a: Yes, removing the skin cuts about 600 kcal, bringing the total to around 1200 kcal.

faqs.q: Why is sodium high in rotisserie chicken?
faqs.a: Due to added salt and seasonings during roasting; a whole chicken can have up to 2500 mg.

faqs.q: How does rotisserie chicken compare to home-roasted?
faqs.a: Similar calories if skin-on, but store-bought often has more sodium from brining.
